The Skeleton: The cause of death was poison.
The skeletton was the Rigid One.
The murderer was the Shaped One.
The main motive: the Rigid One was keeping the Shaped One captive.
The secondary motive: the Rigid One is responsible for the death of the Loose One.
The Cult's Rituals: The cult was whorshipping "sewi", the toki pona concept of divinity.
The cult considered "pona" (simplicity) to be the highest quality of "sewi".
The Enlightened One was the founder of the cult.
The cult made tools out of clay-magic.
The cult made the tool that the player is using.
The cult made a bunch of clay mannequins.
The cult believed that souls were a part of "sewi".
The cult wanted to make an artificial person (to put a part of "sewi" in an artificially made body).
The cult wanted to use clay-magic to create the artificial person.
The artificial person was supposed to become a "perfect mind".
The cult succeeded in creating the clay-person.
The cult wanted to use toki pona to shape the mind of the clay-person.
The Shaped One is the clay-person.
There was a secret room accessible only by the Enlightened One.
A mirror was needed to put the "sewi" into the clay-person.
The mirror is in the secret room.
To open the secret room, the tool acts like a key.
To open the secret room, the user needs to "toki lon" ("speak the truth" or "tell what is", which means answering the door's questions).
The door's questions are never the same, they change with the events that occur within the temple.
Each Character's Fate: The Enlightened one was the founder of the cult.
The Enlightened One is dead and burried in the sacred resting place.
The Enlightened One died of food poisoning.
The Loose One was responsible for the preparation of the meal that killed the Enlightened One.
The Enlightened One considered the Rigid One and the Loose One to be equal disciples.
Someone poisonned the Enlightened One's last meal.
The Enlightened One knew the meal was poisonned.
The Rigid One poisonned the meal that killed the Enlightened One.
The Rigid One joined the cult first, the Loose One joined later.
The Loose One tended to neglect her duties.
The Loose One played a lot of musical instruments.
The Loose One died by food poisonning in the same way as the Enlightened One.
(Red herring) It seems the Loose One committed suicide by poisonning their food.
(Red herring) It seems the Loose One killed herself because of guilt over the Enlightened One's murder, and/or over her manipulatiion of the Shaped One.
The Loose One was murdered by the Rigid One.
The Loose One and the Shaped One had fun together.
The Loose One was manipulating the Shaped One. She used them to do her chores, was lovebombing them, etc.
The Rigid One was infuriated to learn that the Enlightened One considered him as equal to the Loose One in toki pona worship.
The Rigid One tended to give orders to the others.
The Rigid One was pushing for the creation of the Shaped One, but the Enlightened One considered them not to be ready.
The Rigid One showed love to both the Loose One and the Shaped One.
The Shaped One realized that the Loose One was manipulative after a talk with the Rigid One.
The Shaped One knew nothing at first.
The Shaped One struggled with some toki pona concepts (main example: binary gender).
The Shaped One brought new words to toki pona.
The Loose One found the new words ingenious and useful.
The Rigid One strongly disapproved of the new words.
The Shaped One resented the Rigid One for its strictness.
The tool was actually made for the Shaped One.
The tool was made long before the Shaped One.
Before the Shaped One was made, it was forbidden to use the tool except for specific rituals.
The Shaped One used the tool to train their toki pona skills.
The Rigid One forbid the Shaped One to use the tool on the Enlightened One's grave.
Using the tool on the Enlightened One's grave, the Shaped One heard a confession of the Rigid One, demanding pardon to the Enlightened One for his actions.
The Shaped One had a suspicion that the Loose One death was no accident.
The Shaped One found the bottle of poison in the Rigid One's room.
The Shaped One confronted the Rigid One for the murders of the Enlightened One and of the Loose One.
The Player Character's Identity: The player character is looking for the "first person".
The "first person" is the Shaped One.
The Shaped One founded a whole race of clay-people.
